name: Mandibles
description:
Almost a decade after my past retro remakes we have again taken a journey into remaking the past. What if Jaws for the NES was expanded into the game it set out to be with a development time of 30 days with an experienced game developer?

Sail from island to island and perform jobs for the locals to earn money, upgrade your diver and ship, and prepare yourself to hunt the giant man-eating shark lurking in these waters.

But you aren't the only hunter. Mandibles is searching the waters for food and growing his army of oceanic warriors.  The more time passes and the more it eats the more dangerous were journey will become. Eventually, he'll come for the final showdown.

The rules are simple... it dies and you win. You die... and it does.

Do you have what it takes to stop the rampaging shark?

Features:

  • Explore the sea freely
  • Fight the beast from "safety" of your boat or face it on its home turf
  • Three types of jobs: Hunting, Deliveries, or Treasure Hunts
  • Several Upgrades both to your diver, boat, and weapons to best suit your own playstyle
  • A dynamic foe that plays by its own set of rules that cause it to grow differently every time you play, but can be sabotaged by exploited by a skilled hunter.
